intro: Sarcomeris coriacea, commonly known as the rough skin plant, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its thick, waxy leaves that give it a leathery texture. Its flowers are typically pale yellow or white, with five petals and numerous stamens. Sarcomeris coriacea is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its unique foliage and ability to thrive in humid conditions.
